Outbreak reported from Sadayampalayam, Pradaveedu PHC, under Elanthakuttal Block. Out of 18 sera samples sent to Govt. Kumaramagalam Medical College Hospital, Salem, four samples were confirmed as IgM positive for Chikungunya. Source reduction and fogging done. IEC activities done. Medical team continuing surveillance in the affected village.

Outbreak reported from Bharathidhasam nagar village (10 cases) and Burigamanimita village (18 cases) under Pichnaur PHC of Tirupathur block. District RRT investigation done. Cases presented with fever, joint pain, body ache and myalgia. Examination of blood smear ruled out malaria. Serum samples sent to lab for analysis; result awaited. Door to door fever surveillance conducted. Anti-larval activities carried out. Health education given.

Outbreak reported from Melaparaikulam, Paralachi PHC. Cases presented with fever associated with headache, nausea, vomiting, arthralgia and myalgia. 6 serum samples collected and sent for analysis to SE.ZET, Virudhunagar; result awaited. Source reduction measures and fogging done. Health education given regarding prevention measures.

Outbreak reported from villages Peravoor, Kolayad, Kanichar, Kelakam, Maloor & Muzahakunnu (BPHC Keezhpally / Iritty). District Malaria Officer and medical officer with staff visited the area. Cases presented with fever associated with joint swelling and rashes. Serum samples collected and sent to NIV, Pune for lab analysis, reports awaited. Source reduction done. IEC activities under taken.

Outbreak reported from Pattanam village under Vadugam PHC. Cases presented with fever and arthralgia. Serum samples collected from 5 patients to confirm Chikungunya; reports awaited. Source reduction measures and fogging operation carried out in the affected village.

Outbreak reported from Vetuvapatty village, Chittoor PHC. Cases presented with fever, joint pain, myalgia and difficulty in walking. Blood smears of all cases tested negative for malaria. 7 serum samples collected and sent to GMK Medical College for serology; result awaited. Entomological survey revealed high vector density. All cases treated symptomatically. Anti-larval measures and fogging operations undertaken. IEC activities undertaken.

Outbreak reported from Kodugur Kudikadu village under Edaiyakurichi PHC. 24 Sera samples sent to Sr Entomologist of Zonal Entomological Team, Trichy, for lab investigation; reports awaited. Entomological surveillance done to assess the larval density. Source reduction measures done and health education given about personal protection measures.

Cases reported from Valluvarpuram village, Chinthagampalli PHC under Bargur Block. 15 blood smears collected tested negative for malaria. Investigation done by dist RRT. High larval (Aedes) density found on entomological survey. House to house survey being done for new fever cases.

Cases reported from Boothipuram village, PHC Dobucherry, Bodinayakanur block. Four sera samples tested positive for Chikungunya at Govt. Medical College Hospital, Theni. House to house fever survey done. On entomological survey, high density of Aedes larvae found in water storage containers in the houses. Source reduction measures and fogging operations done. Health education given regarding personal protection measures.

Cases reported from Jaya theatre colony, Sarkar kottapatty PHC, with symptoms of fever, joint pain and difficulty in walking. RRT investigation done. Blood smears collected from fever cases found negative for malaria. Serum sample collected and sent to Zonal Entomological Team (ZET), Salem for investigation; result awaited. Health education given regarding personal prophylactic measures.

Outbreak reported from Cheruvady and Vanimmal PHC areas. District Rapid Response Team (RRT) investigated outbreak. Environment found favorable for mosquito breeding at rubber plantations. Mosquito control activities taken up. Serum samples collected and sent to Microbiology lab, Cheravady; result awaited. IEC activities taken up regarding personal protection measures.

Cases presented with fever, joint pain and difficulty in walking from Nagireddiyur village under PHC Sedapatti. All cases treated symptomatically. Blood smears tested negative for malaria. Serum sample collected and sent to Zonal Entomological Team (ZET) Salem; result awaited. Anti-larval measures and fogging operations

Outbreak reported from Kalaperumalpatti village, PHC Avudiapuram. Cases presented with symptoms of fever, arthralgia, myalgia, conjunctival suffusion and pain abdomen. Medical team posted in the area to treat cases. Daily fever survey conducted in the area. Antilarval measures undertaken, all available breeding containers treated with Abate. Indoor fogging operations done with pyrethrum. Health education given to all for source reduction activities in households. Serum samples collected and sent to the senior entomologist, Zonal Entomological Team, Virudhunagar for testing for Dengue, Leptospirosis and Chikungunya.

Outbreak reported from Theerthampalayam village, PHC Kallapalli. Serum sample sent to ZET for further analysis. 21 blood smears examined found negative for malaria. All vector control measures taken up like Temephos application, source reductions and fogging operations with pyrethrum extract, etc. Health education given to the all households regarding source reduction activities and personal protection measures.

Outbreak reported from Sundarajapuram village, Rajathani PHC due to mixed dwelling. Fever survey conducted in the affected area. Antilarval measures undertaken, all available breeding containers treated with Abate. Indoor fogging operations done with pyrethrum. Serum samples collected tested negative for Dengue and Leptospirosis at Govt. Theni Medical College and ZET Dindugl. Health education given regarding source reduction activities in households.

Outbreak reported from neighboring villages Nannamullu, Kuttipuram, Thavanoor, Vengara, Tenchipalam. Source reduction measures undertaken and fogging and spraying operations done. Health education given to the community. All cases treated symptomatically.

Outbreak reported from PHC Cheruvady and PHC Vanimmal. Environment found favorable for mosquito breeding (at rubber plantations). District RRT investigated the affected area. Serum samples sent to Microbiology lab for testing for Chikungunya; result awaited. Fogging and spraying activities and source reduction measures undertaken. IEC activities undertaken regarding personal prophylactic measures.

Cases reported from Sathya Nagar village, Kannankurichi PHC (43 cases), Vasampalli Therkathi Kadu village, PHC Kolathur (12 cases), Poovanoor Colony village, Vaikuntham PHC (12 cases) with symptoms of fever, joint pain and difficulty in walking. RRT investigation done. Blood smears collected from fever cases found negative for malaria. Serum samples collected and sent to Zonal Entomological Team (ZET) Salem for investigation; result awaited. Health education given regarding personal prophylactic measures.

Cases reported from Vadalivilai village, Panagudi PHC with clinical symptoms of Chikungunya. Door to door survey done for new fever cases. Serum sample taken from all cases for lab investigation. Anti-larval measures undertaken like abate application and source reduction. Health education given regarding personal protection measures.

Cases reported from Mettupatti – Dhanur, PHC Achankuttapatti with symptoms of fever, joint pain, myalgia. All fever cases treated symptomatically. High larval density found on entomological survey. Blood smears found negative for malaria. Serum samples sent to IVC&Z, Hosur for testing for Chikungunya; result awaited. Anti larval measures, fogging operation and fever surveillance undertaken in the affected village and surrounding villages. The overhead tanks cleaned and disinfected. Medical camp conducted in the affected area. IEC activities undertaken.

Outbreak reported from Marakkara, Makkaraparamba, Pang, Moorkanad, Vengara, Irringallur, Othukkungal, Edarikode, A.R Nagar, Tanur. Source reduction measures, fogging, spraying done for control of the vector. Medical camps conducted to treat cases. Health education given regarding personal prophylactic measures. IEC activities undertaken.

Outbreak reported from Lingathur village, Uppidamangalam PHC. The outbreak probably occurred due to migration of affected population from the Chikungunya affected area. High vector density has been noticed in the area. 22 blood slides examined found negative for malaria. Serum samples collected and sent to Zonal Entomological Team (ZET) for lab analysis. Anti-larval measures undertaken and fogging operation carried out in the area. Health education given.

Outbreak reported from Cheillyampalayam (Karkudai panchayat), Mullukuruchi PHC. All cases treated. Serum samples taken and sent to SE, ZET, Salem for confirmation of Chikungunya, Entomological survey done revealed high vector indices. Source reduction measures undertaken and fogging operation done. IEC activities undertaken.

Outbreak reported from Periya Mayakulam, PHC Velanur, Block Thiruppullani. RRT visited the affected area. Out of 9 serum samples sent to Zonal Entomological Team (ZET), Virudhunagar, two tested positive for IgM Chikungunya antibodies. Source reduction and temephos application done in the affected area.

Outbreak reported from Praharajpur village under Delang Block. Cases presented with fever, arthralgia, headache and body ache. District Rapid Response Team (RRT) visited the affected area and investigated the outbreak. 20 blood slides collected found negative for malaria parasite. Out of 11 serum samples sent for testing to SCB Medical College, Cuttack, 2 samples tested positive for Chikungunya IgM. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given regarding personal protection measures.

Cases reported from Ayyankottai village, PHC Ayyampalayam with symptoms of fever and arthralgia. All the fever cases are screened for malaria parasite found negative. Serum samples collected sent to department of microbiology of Madurai Medical College, for analysis of Chikungunya, Dengue, Leptospirosis and Typhoid; result awaited. House to house survey done for new fever cases and breeding sites of mosquitoes. Anti-larval measures undertaken and fogging done. IEC activities undertaken and health education given regarding breeding of mosquitoes, mode of transmission and personal protection measures.

Outbreak reported from Keelakodumalur village, Block Melakodumalur. Mosquito breeding sites found in most of the houses. Serum samples sent for lab test to Zonal Entomological Team, Virudhunagar; result awaited. Abate application and fogging operations done. Health education given regarding personal protection measures.

Cases reported from Ayyanar Koli Street and Karumariyamman Kloi Street, PHC Thirunedunkula. Entomological survey conducted in the village. Out of eight serum samples collected, three found positive for Chikungunya. Anti larval activities like source reduction measures undertaken, and fogging operations carried out in the affected village. Health education given to affected population to control the mosquito breeding by cleaning the drain and removing garbage.

Outbreak reported from Vengalam village, PHC Arumbavur. District RRT visited the affected area. Four sera samples collected and sent it to Sr. Entomologist, Zonal Entomological Team (ZET), Trichy. Door to door fever survey done. Source reduction and fogging operation done. Health education given regarding personal protection measures.

Cases reported from Kovilpatty colony, Kaniyalampatty PHC. District RRT visited the affected area. Outbreak occurred in migrant laborers who came from outside the district, spread to local inhabitants in this area. 15 blood smears collected and examined found negative for malaria. 4 sera collected and sent to Trichy. Door to door fever surveillance done for new cases..

Active surveillance done in the affected area to find new cases. 24 sera samples collected and sent to NICED (National Institute for Cholera and Enteric Diseases), Kolkata; report awaited. Medical camp established to treat cases.

Outbreak reported from Chowdhuri Para and Beneroi Puberbagan villages of Makardah Gram Panchayat area,. Domjur Block. Block and District Medical officers’ team visited the area. Monitoring and supervision by district officials. 50 Blood sample collected and sent to STM (School of Tropical Medicine), 8 Blood sample was Chikungunya IgM reactive. Cases treated and advised increased fluids intake, IEC activities under taken. Medicine Depot made ready at block level.

Cases reported from village Killukottai, Block Kunnandarkovil PHC Visalikovil. District RRT visited the affected area. 6 out of 8 sera samples from fever cases sent to Chief Entomological, Zonal Entomological Team (ZET), Trichy tested positive for IgM Chikungunya. IEC activities undertaken.

Outbreak reported from neighboring villages under Block Domjur. District and RRT visited the affected area. 16 sera samples tested positive for Chikungunya IgM, and 3 were reactive for Dengue IgM. Surveillance is being carried out by the medical team. IEC activities undertaken and health education imparted.

Outbreak reported from Block Domjur, GP- Makardah-I Chowdhuri Para and Benerol Puberbagan, Patrapara, Sanipara. Treatment of cases and monitoring done by District Health Officials. 16 serum samples tested Chikungunya IgM positive and three samples reactive for Dengue IgM. Active search by filed staff done for new fever cases. All cases treated for symptomatically. IEC activities undertaken and mosquito nets distributed.

Cases reported from village Vannia paraipatty, PHC M.M.Kovilur. District RRT visited the affected area. Out of four sera samples sent to Zonal Entomological Team (ZET), Dindigul, two found positive for Chikungunya. Nine blood smears collected found negative for malaria. Aedes breeding sites identified in cisterns, old tyres, mud pots, etc. House to house search done for new cases. Symptomatic treatment given to all cases. Anti larval measures undertaken and health awareness camps organized regarding vector-borne disease prevention measures.

Cases reported from village Ade (Koliwada), Sub Centre Ilne, PHC Kelshi, Taluka Dapoli. All sera samples tested positive for IgM anti-Chikungunya antibodies. House to house surveillance done for new fever cases. Container survey done. Health education given regarding personal protection measures.

Outbreak reported from village Thoravallur, PHC Perumanallur. District RRT visited the affected area. 47 Blood smears collected and examined for Malaria and all are found negative. Six sera samples collected and sent to ZET (Zonal Entomological Team), Coimbatore and IVC&Z, Hosur for lab investigation; result awaited. All available mosquito breeding sites treated with Abate. Indoor thermal fogging done with 2% Pyrethrum. IEC activities undertaken.

Cases clinically diagnosed as Chikungunya reported from Village Neikkuppal, PHC Anukkur, Block Veppanthattai. District RRT visited the affected area. Five serum samples collected and sent to SE, ZET, Trichy; result awaited. Door to door survey done. High larval density found in breeding sites. Source reduction measures and fogging operation done. Health education given to villagers.

Cases reported from village Nariyuthu, PHC Kdamalakikundu, Block Gandamanur. District RRT visited the affected area. 10 blood smear samples collected and found negative for malaria Out of five serum samples sent to ZET, Dindigul; four samples tested positive for Chikungunya. Abate application done, source reduction and indoor fogging operation done.

Outbreak of fever reported from village Ayythampatti, PHC Thumbalam, Block T.Pet. 38 blood smears and five sera samples collected from cases and sent to SE/ZET, Trichy for analysis. Four sera samples tested positive for Chikungunya.

Cases reported from Village Pidupatti, Block Aruppukottai, PHC Malaipatti due to consumption of contaminated water. District RRT visited the affected area. A medical team has been posted in the area. Five sera samples collected and sent to the Senior Entomologist, Zonal Entomological Team (ZET), Virudhunagar, for testing of Chikungunya and Dengue. Daily fever surveillance conducted. Anti- larval measures undertaken. All available water storage containers treated with Abate (92 houses covered) and indoor thermal fogging done. Community educated to use bed-nets and mosquito-repellents to avoid mosquito bite. IEC activities done about regularly cleaning and covering the water-storage containers to avoid mosquito breeding.

Cases reported from UHC Vasco, PHC Siolim. On entomological survey, breeding sites found in domestic water storage containers. District Rapid Response Team (RRT) visited the affected area. Vector control measures done and IEC activities undertaken regarding personal protection measures.

Outbreak reported from Village Thirupanjeeli, PHC Sirugambur, Block Manachanllur. District RRT visited the affected area. 15 sera samples collected and sent to KAPV Medical College for analysis of Dengue and Chikungunya. Result yet to be received. Fogging operation and anti larval work conducted and it is being continued. Health education given to the public so as to prevent the mosquito breeding Health education was given to the school and public information given to the Medical Officer PHC Sirugambur to take necessary action to control the mosquito breeding and fever cases. Meeting conducted for local body people and self help group members to prevent aedes mosquito breeding.
